measures.number: Establish Campaign Contribution Limits for State and Local Elections Initiative
measures.title: Establish Campaign Contribution Limits for State and Local Elections Initiative
measures.description: Establish new campaign contribution limits for campaigns for state and local office. This citizen-initiated measure is on the Alaska 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Repeal Top-Four Ranked-Choice Voting Initiative
measures.description: Repeal the top-four ranked-choice voting (RCV) system that was adopted in 2020. This citizen-initiated measure is on the Alaska 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Amendment 1
measures.description: Add discharging a firearm in an occupied dwelling or other occupied space and any solicitation, attempt, or conspiracy to commit murder to the list of crimes for which a judge may deny bail

measures.title: Amendment 2
measures.description: Prohibit any reduction in a district attorney's compensation during their term in office

measures.number: Increase Age Limit for Walker County Judge of Probate from 70 to 75 Amendment
measures.title: Increase Age Limit for Walker County Judge of Probate from 70 to 75 Amendment
measures.description: Increase the age limit for the judge of probate in Walker County from 70 to 75
measures.category: State judicial selection; Age limits for officials

measures.title: Citizenship Requirement for Voting Amendment
measures.description: Provide that only U.S. citizens may vote in state or local elections. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Arkansas 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Creation of Economic Development Districts Amendment
measures.title: Creation of Economic Development Districts Amendment
measures.description: Allow the legislature to create programs, including Economic Development Districts, and make loans and grants of public money to develop the state economy. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Arkansas 2026 ballot.
measures.category: Local government; Local government; Economic investment

measures.title: Natural Resources Commission Bond Measure
measures.description: Authorize the Arkansas Natural Resources Commission to issue up to $500 million in general obligation bonds to fund water-related infrastructure projects including water treatment and transportation, waste disposal, pollution abatement, drainage, irrigation, flood control, and wetlands and aquatic resources infrastructure. This legislative referendum is on the Arkansas 2026 ballot.
measures.category: Flood infrastructure; Storm infrastructure; Irrigation; Sewage and stormwater; Pollution; Parks and conservation; Bonds

measures.number: Right to Keep and Bear Arms Amendment
measures.title: Right to Keep and Bear Arms Amendment
measures.description: Provide that the right to keep and bear arms is "a natural, fundamental, and individual right that shall not be infringed". This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Arkansas 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Designate Drug Cartels as Terrorist Organizations and Require State DHS to Address Threats Measure
measures.title: Designate Drug Cartels as Terrorist Organizations and Require State DHS to Address Threats Measure
measures.description: Declare drug cartels to be terrorist organizations. This legislative referendum is on the Arizona 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Limit Local Tax Rate on Groceries to 2% of Base Price and Require Voter Approval to Increase Tax Rate Measure
measures.title: Limit Local Tax Rate on Groceries to 2% of Base Price and Require Voter Approval to Increase Tax Rate Measure
measures.description: Prohibit local government from imposing or increasing a tax on the sale of food items without voter approval and cap the tax rate at 2%. This legislative referendum is on the Arizona 2026 ballot.
measures.category: Ballot measures; Food and beverage taxes; Sales taxes

measures.number: Prohibit Taxes or Fees on Miles Traveled in Motor Vehicle Amendment
measures.title: Prohibit Taxes or Fees on Miles Traveled in Motor Vehicle Amendment
measures.description: Prohibit the state and local governments from imposing taxes or fees based on vehicle miles traveled and from enacting rules to monitor or limit vehicle miles traveled without the person’s consent. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Arizona 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Allow Public Financing of Election Campaigns Measure
measures.title: Allow Public Financing of Election Campaigns Measure
measures.description: Allow the state and local governments to create programs that provide candidates with public funds under spending limits and eligibility rules. This legislative referendum is on the California 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Eliminate Successor Election at a State Officer Recall Election Amendment
measures.title: Eliminate Successor Election at a State Officer Recall Election Amendment
measures.description: Eliminate the successor election when a state officer is recalled, thereby leaving the office vacant until it is filled according to state law. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the California 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Vote Requirements for Initiatives Requiring Supermajority Votes Amendment
measures.title: Vote Requirements for Initiatives Requiring Supermajority Votes Amendment
measures.description: Require initiatives that change vote thresholds to supermajority votes to pass by the same vote requirement as is being proposed. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the California 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Initiative 85
measures.description: Increase penalties for fentanyl-related felonies, require treatment for certain drug offenses, and limit sentencing exceptions in fentanyl-related crimes that cause another person’s death. This citizen-initiated measure is on the Colorado 2026 ballot.

measures.title: Initiative 95
measures.description: Require law enforcement to notify the U.S. Department of Homeland Security when a person is charged with a crime of violence or has a prior felony conviction and the person’s immigration status cannot be determined. This citizen-initiated measure is on the Colorado 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Changes to Budget Stabilization Fund Amendment
measures.title: Changes to Budget Stabilization Fund Amendment

measures.number: Exempt Tangible Personal Property Used for Agriculture or Agritourism from Property Taxes Amendment
measures.title: Exempt Tangible Personal Property Used for Agriculture or Agritourism from Property Taxes Amendment

measures.number: Increase Acre Limit for Agriculture and Timber Conservation Use Property Tax Classification Amendment
measures.title: Increase Acre Limit for Agriculture and Timber Conservation Use Property Tax Classification Amendment
measures.description: Increase the maximum acreage of agricultural and timber property that can be classified as bona fide conservation use property, which is taxed at 40% of the land's value, from 2,000 acres to 4,000 acres. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment is on the Georgia 2026 ballot.

measures.number: Increase Time for Senate to Act on Judicial Appointments Amendment
measures.title: Increase Time for Senate to Act on Judicial Appointments Amendment

measures.title: HJR 4

measures.title: Citizenship Voting Requirement Amendment

measures.number: Elections for Supreme Court Justices Amendment

measures.number: Allow Parishes to Exempt Business Inventory from Property Taxation Amendment
measures.title: Allow Parishes to Exempt Business Inventory from Property Taxation Amendment

measures.number: Increase Judicial Retirement Age to 75 Years Amendment
measures.title: Increase Judicial Retirement Age to 75 Years Amendment

measures.number: Legislative Authority to Add or Remove Unclassified Civil Service Positions Amendment
measures.title: Legislative Authority to Add or Remove Unclassified Civil Service Positions Amendment

measures.number: Raise Income Limit to $150,000 for Special Property Tax Assessment Amendment

This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the Oregon 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 57.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Question 1
measures.description: Call for a state constitutional convention to be held. This advisory question was placed on the Rhode Island 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 38.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Question 2
measures.description: Issue $160.5 million in bonds for improvements to higher education facilities. This bond measure was placed on the Rhode Island 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 60.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Question 3
measures.description: Issue $120 million in bonds to increase the availability of housing in the state. This bond measure was placed on the Rhode Island 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 66.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Question 4
measures.description: Issue $53 million in bonds for environmental-related infrastructure, local recreation projects, and for preservation of land. This bond measure was placed on the Rhode Island 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 67.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Question 5
measures.description: Issue $10 million in bonds for funding for 1:1 matching grants to continue the Cultural Arts and Economy Grant program administered by the Rhode Island state council on the arts, and for improvements and renovations to the Tomaquag Museum, the Newport Contemporary Ballet, and the Trinity Repertory Company. This bond measure was placed on the Rhode Island 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 56.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Citizenship Requirement for Voting Amendment
measures.description: Prohibit the state and local governments from allowing noncitizens to vote. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the South Carolina 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 86.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Constitutional Amendment E
measures.description: Amend the constitution to change male pronouns in the Constitution to gender-neutral terms or titles. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the South Dakota 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 43.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Constitutional Amendment F
measures.description: Amend the South Dakota Constitution to provide that the state "may impose a work requirement on any person ... who has not been diagnosed as being physically or mentally disabled" for eligible individuals to receive Medicaid under the Medicaid expansion that took effect on July 1, 2023. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the South Dakota 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 56.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Constitutional Amendment G
measures.description: Provide for a state constitutional right to abortion with a trimester framework for regulations. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the South Dakota 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 41.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Constitutional Amendment H
measures.description: Establish top-two primaries for federal, state, and certain local offices in South Dakota. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the South Dakota 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 34.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Initiated Measure 28
measures.description: Prohibit state sales taxes on anything sold for human consumption, not including alcoholic beverages or prepared food. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the South Dakota 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 31.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Initiated Measure 29
measures.description: Legalize the recreational or personal use of marijuana. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the South Dakota 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 44.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Referred Law 21
measures.description: Uphold Senate Bill 201, which would provide requirements for regulating carbon dioxide pipelines and other transmission facilities, and allow counties to impose a surcharge on certain pipeline companies. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the South Dakota 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 41.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Amendment B
measures.description: Raise the annual distribution limit from the State School Fund for public education from 4% to 5%. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Utah 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 71.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Amendment C
measures.description: Establish in the state constitution that every county shall elect a sheriff to serve for four-year terms. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Utah 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 83.0% voting yes.

measures.number: Property Tax Exemption for Veterans and Surviving Spouses Amendment
measures.title: Property Tax Exemption for Veterans and Surviving Spouses Amendment
measures.description: Amend language in the Virginia Constitution regarding property tax exemptions for veterans and surviving spouses to say died in the line of duty rather than killed in action. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Virginia 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 93.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Initiative 2066
measures.description: Prohibit state and local governments from restricting access to natural gas. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the Washington 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 52.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Initiative 2109
measures.description: Repeal the capital gains excise tax imposed on long-term capital assets by individuals with capital gains over $250,000. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the Washington 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 36.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Initiative 2117
measures.description: Prohibit carbon tax credit trading and repeal provisions of the 2021 Washington Climate Commitment Act (CCA), a state law that provided for a cap and invest program designed to reduce greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by 95% by 2050. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the Washington 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 38.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Initiative 2124
measures.description: Allow all employees and self-employed individuals to opt out of paying the tax and receiving benefits under WA Cares, the state's long-term services and supports trust health care program. This citizen-initiated measure was placed on the Washington 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 45.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Citizenship Voting Requirement Amendment
measures.description: Prohibit the state and local governments from allowing noncitizens to vote. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Wisconsin 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 71.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Question 1
measures.description: Prohibit any level of government in the state from applying or accepting non-governmental funds or equipment for election administration. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Wisconsin 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 54.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Question 1
measures.description: Prohibit the legislature from delegating its power to appropriate money. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Wisconsin 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 43.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Question 2
measures.description: Provide that only election officials designated by law may administer elections. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Wisconsin 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 59.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Question 2
measures.description: Require legislative approval before the governor can expend federal money appropriated to the state. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Wisconsin 2024 ballot. Voters rejected it with only 42.0% voting yes.

measures.title: Amendment 1
measures.description: Prohibit people from participating in "the practice of medically assisted suicide, euthanasia, or mercy killing of a person". This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the West Virginia 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 50.0% voting yes.

measures.number: Property Tax on Residential Property and Owner-Occupied Primary Residences Amendment
measures.title: Property Tax on Residential Property and Owner-Occupied Primary Residences Amendment
measures.description: Add residential real property as a fourth, separate, class of property and authorize the legislature to create a subclass of residential property for owner-occupied primary residences, which could be assessed at a rate other than the uniform rate for property in the class. This legislatively referred constitutional amendment was placed on the Wyoming 2024 ballot. Voters approved it with 59.0% voting yes.

measures.category: State and local government budgets, spending and finance

measures.title: Colorado Proposition 119, Creation of Out-of-School Education Program and Marijuana Sales Tax Increase Initiative (2021)
measures.description: Creates an out-of-school education program and a board to govern it and increases the marijuana retail sales tax by 5% to partially fund the program

measures.title: Colorado Proposition 120, Reduce Property Tax Rates and Retain $25 Million in TABOR Surplus Revenue Initiative (2021)
measures.description: Reduces the residential and non-residential property tax rates; authorizes the state to retain and spend $25 million in revenue above the state's TABOR spending cap, which it would otherwise be required to refund to taxpayers

measures.title: Louisiana Amendment 1, Creation of the State and Local Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Commission Measure (2021)
measures.description: Amends the Louisiana Constitution to create the State and Local Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Commission

measures.title: Louisiana Amendment 2, Reduction of the Maximum Individual Income Tax Rate Measure (2021)
measures.description: Amends the Louisiana Constitution to decrease the maximum rate of individual income tax from 6% to 4.75%

measures.title: Louisiana Amendment 3, Authorize Certain Levee Districts to Collect a Five-Mill Annual Property Tax Measure (2021)
measures.description: Allows Louisiana levee districts created after 2006 to levy an annual property tax of up to five mills ($5 per $1,000 of assessed value) without voter approval if those districts approve the 2021 constitutional amendment (continues voter approval requirement for property taxes levied in districts that do not approve the amendment)

measures.title: Louisiana Amendment 4, Increase Limit on Funding Reductions and Redirections During Budget Deficits Measure (2021)
measures.description: Increases the amount of funds (from 5% to 10%) that can be redirected to a purpose other than what was originally provided for by law or as stated in the constitution during a projected budget deficit

measures.title: Maine Question 1, Electric Transmission Line Restrictions and Legislative Approval Initiative (2021)
measures.description: Prohibits the construction of electric transmission lines in the Upper Kennebec Region and requires a two-thirds vote of each state legislative chamber to approve electric transmission line projects defined as high-impact

measures.title: Maine Question 2, Transportation Infrastructure Bond Issue (2021)
measures.description: Issues $100 million in bonds for transportation infrastructure

measures.title: Maine Question 3, Right to Produce, Harvest, and Consume Food Amendment (2021)
measures.description: Creates a state constitutional right to a produce, harvest, and consume food

measures.title: New Jersey Public Question 1, Sports Betting on State College Athletics Amendment (2021)
measures.description: Allows wagering on postseason college sport competitions held in N.J. and competitions in which a N.J.-based college team participates

measures.title: New Jersey Public Question 2, Raffle Money for Organizations Amendment (2021)
measures.description: Allows organizations to use raffle money to raise money for their own organization

measures.title: New York Proposal 1, Redistricting Changes Amendment (2021)
measures.description: Makes changes to the redistricting process in New York

measures.title: New York Proposal 2, Environmental Rights Amendment (2021)
measures.description: Creates a state constitutional right to clean air, clean water, and a healthful environment

measures.title: New York Proposal 3, Remove 10-Day-Advance Voter Registration Requirement Amendment (2021)
measures.description: Authorizes the legislature to pass a law for same-day voter registration

measures.title: New York Proposal 4, Allow for No-Excuse Absentee Voting Amendment (2021)
measures.description: Authorizes the legislature to pass a law for no-excuse absentee voting

measures.title: New York Proposal 5, NYC Civil Court Jurisdiction Amendment (2021)
measures.description: Increases the NYC Civil Court's jurisdiction from civil cases involving $25,000 to $50,000

measures.title: Pennsylvania Question 1, Legislative Resolution to Extend or Terminate Emergency Declaration Amendment (May 2021)
measures.description: Empowers the legislature to extend or terminate a emergency declaration by resolution

measures.title: Pennsylvania Question 2, Emergency Declarations Amendment (May 2021)
measures.description: Addresses the governor's emergency powers, including requiring legislative approval to continue beyond 21 days

measures.title: Pennsylvania Question 3, Equal Rights Regardless of Race or Ethnicity Amendment (May 2021)
measures.description: Prohibits denial or abridgement of rights on account of an individual's race or ethnicity

measures.title: Pennsylvania Question 4, Municipal Fire and EMS Services Loans Measure (May 2021)
measures.description: Expands the state's loan program to volunteer fire companies to municipal fire companies and EMS service nonprofits

measures.title: Rhode Island Question 1, Higher Education Bond Measure (March 2021)
measures.description: Issues $107.3 million in bonds for the University of Rhode Island Fine Arts Center, the Rhode Island College Clarke Science Building, and the Community College of Rhode Island

measures.title: Rhode Island Question 2, State Beaches and Water Bond Measure (March 2021)
measures.description: Issues $74 million in bonds for state beaches, parks, recreational facilities, and water projects

measures.title: Rhode Island Question 3, Housing Bond Measure (March 2021)
measures.description: Issues $65 million in bonds for building and renovating housing projects

measures.title: Rhode Island Question 4, Transportation Bond Measure (March 2021)
measures.description: Issues $71.7 million in bonds for transportation infrastructure

measures.title: Rhode Island Question 5, Early Childhood Care and Education Capital Fund Bond Measure (March 2021)
measures.description: Issues $15 million in bonds for the Early Childhood Care and Education Capital Fund

measures.title: Rhode Island Question 6, Cultural Arts and State Preservation Grant Programs Bond Measure (March 2021)
measures.description: Issues $7 million in bonds for the Cultural Arts and the Economy Grant Program and the State Preservation Grants Program

measures.title: Rhode Island Question 7, Improvements to Industrial Facilities Infrastructure Bond Measure (March 2021)
measures.description: Issues $60 million in bonds to fund improvements to industrial facilities infrastructure

measures.title: Texas Proposition 1, Authorize Charitable Raffles at Rodeo Venues Amendment (2021)
measures.description: Authorizes professional sports team charitable organizations to conduct raffles at rodeo venues

measures.title: Texas Proposition 2, Authorize Counties to Issue Infrastructure Bonds in Blighted Areas Amendment (2021)
measures.description: Authorizes  a county to issue bonds to fund infrastructure and transportation projects in undeveloped and blighted areas

measures.title: Texas Proposition 3, Prohibition on Limiting Religious Services or Organizations Amendment (2021)
measures.description: Amends the Texas Constitution to prohibit the state or any political subdivision from enacting a law, rule, order, or proclamation that limits religious services or organizations

measures.title: Texas Proposition 4, Changes to Eligibility for Certain Judicial Offices Amendment (2021)
measures.description: Changes the eligibility requirements for the following judicial offices: a justice of the supreme court, a judge of the court of criminal appeals, a justice of a court of appeals, and a district judge

measures.title: Texas Proposition 5, State Commission on Judicial Conduct Authority Over Candidates for Judicial Office Amendment (2021)
measures.description: Authorizes the Texas State Commission on Judicial Conduct to accept and investigate complaints and reports against candidates running for state judicial office

measures.title: Texas Proposition 6, Right to Designated Essential Caregiver Amendment (2021)
measures.description: Amends the Texas Constitution to state that residents of nursing facilities, assisted living facilities, or state-supported living centers have a right to designate an essential caregiver that may not be prohibited from visiting the resident

measures.title: Texas Proposition 7, Homestead Tax Limit for Surviving Spouses of Disabled Individuals Amendment (2021)
measures.description: Amends the Texas Constitution to allow the legislature to extend a homestead tax limit for surviving spouses of disabled individuals as long as the spouse is 55 years old and resides at the  home

measures.title: Texas Proposition 8, Homestead Tax Exemption for Surviving Spouses of Military Fatally Injured in the Line of Duty Amendment (2021)
measures.description: Amends the Texas Constitution to allow the legislature to apply a homestead tax exemption for surviving spouses of members of the military to those fatally injured in the line of duty

measures.title: Washington Advisory Vote 36, Nonbinding Question on Telephone Tax to Fund Behavioral Health Crisis Response and Suicide Prevention (2021)
measures.description: Advises the legislature to either maintain or repeal a tax on phone lines to fund behavioral health and suicide prevention services passed in House Bill 1477

measures.title: Washington Advisory Vote 37, Nonbinding Question on Capital Gains Tax to Fund Education and Child Care (2021)
measures.description: Advises the legislature to either maintain or repeal a capital gains tax increase to fund education and child services passed in Senate Bill 5096

measures.title: Washington Advisory Vote 38, Nonbinding Question on Captive Insurers Tax (2021)
measures.description: Advises the legislature to either maintain or repeal a tax on captive insurers passed in Senate Bill 5315

measures.title: Alaska Ballot Measure 1, North Slope Oil Production Tax Increase Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Increases taxes on certain oil production in the North Slope

measures.title: Alaska Ballot Measure 2, Top-Four Ranked-Choice Voting and Campaign Finance Laws Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Changes to Alaska's election policies, including top-four primaries, ranked-choice voting, and campaign finance laws

measures.title: Alabama Amendment 1, Citizenship Requirement for Voting Measure (2020)
measures.description: States that only a U.S. citizen who is 18 years old or older can vote in Alabama

measures.title: Alabama Amendment 1, Appointed Education Board Amendment (March 2020)
measures.description: Changes to the state education board, including requiring members to be appointed by the governor

measures.title: Alabama Amendment 2, Judicial System Restructuring Measure (2020)
measures.description: Makes changes to judicial law and court systems and procedures

measures.title: Alabama Amendment 3, Judicial Vacancies Measure (2020)
measures.description: Provide that a judge, other than a probate judge, appointed to fill a vacancy would serve an initial term until the first Monday after the second Tuesday in January following the next general election after the judge has completed two years in office

measures.title: Alabama Amendment 4, Authorize Legislature to Recompile the State Constitution Measure (2020)
measures.description: Authorizes the state legislature during the 2022 regular session to recompile the Alabama Constitution and provide for its ratification

measures.title: Alabama Amendment 5, "Stand Your Ground" Rights in Franklin County Churches Measure (2020)
measures.description: Provides for a "stand your ground" law applicable to individuals in churches in Franklin county

measures.title: Alabama Amendment 6, "Stand Your Ground" Rights in Lauderdale County Churches Measure (2020)
measures.description: Provides for a "stand your ground" law applicable to individuals in churches in Lauderdale county

measures.title: Arkansas Issue 1, Transportation Sales Tax Continuation Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Continues a 0.5 percent sales tax for transportation

measures.title: Arkansas Issue 2, Change State Legislative Term Limits Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Changes term limits to twelve consecutive years for state legislators with the opportunity to return after a four-year break

measures.title: Arkansas Issue 3, Initiative Process and Legislative Referral Requirements Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Changes initiative process and legislative referral requirements

measures.title: Arizona Proposition 207, Marijuana Legalization Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Legalizes the recreational possession and use of marijuana

measures.title: Arizona Proposition 208, Tax on Incomes Exceeding $250,000 for Teacher Salaries and Schools Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Increases the tax on incomes exceeding $250,000 for teacher salaries and schools

measures.title: California Proposition 13, School and College Facilities Bond (March 2020)
measures.description: Issues $15 billion in bonds for school and college facilities

measures.title: California Proposition 14, Stem Cell Research Institute Bond Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Issues $5.5 billion in bonds for state stem cell research institute

measures.title: California Proposition 15, Tax on Commercial and Industrial Properties for Education and Local Government Funding Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Requires commercial and industrial properties to be taxed based on market value and dedicates revenue

measures.title: California Proposition 16, Repeal Proposition 209 Affirmative Action Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Repeals Proposition 209 (1996), which says that the state cannot discriminate or grant preferential treatment based on race, sex, color, ethnicity, or national origin in public employment, education, or contracting

measures.title: California Proposition 17, Voting Rights Restoration for Persons on Parole Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Restores the right to vote to people convicted of felonies who are on parole

measures.title: California Proposition 18, Primary Voting for 17-Year-Olds Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Allows 17-year-olds who will be 18 at the time of the next general election to vote in primaries and special elections

measures.title: California Proposition 19, Property Tax Transfers, Exemptions, and Revenue for Wildfire Agencies and Counties Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Changes tax assessment transfers and inheritance rules

measures.title: California Proposition 20, Criminal Sentencing, Parole, and DNA Collection Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Makes changes to policies related to criminal sentencing charges, prison release, and DNA collection

measures.title: California Proposition 21, Local Rent Control Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Expands local governments' power to use rent control

measures.title: California Proposition 22, App-Based Drivers as Contractors and Labor Policies Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Considers app-based drivers to be independent contractors and enacts several labor policies related to app-based companies

measures.title: California Proposition 23, Dialysis Clinic Requirements Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Requires physician on-site at dialysis clinics and consent from the state for a clinic to close

measures.title: California Proposition 24, Consumer Personal Information Law and Agency Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Expands the provisions of the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) and creates the California Privacy Protection Agency to implement and enforce the CCPA

measures.title: California Proposition 25, Replace Cash Bail with Risk Assessments Referendum (2020)
measures.description: Replaces cash bail with risk assessments for suspects awaiting trial

measures.title: Colorado Amendment 76, Citizenship Requirement for Voting Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Amends the Colorado Constitution to state that “only a citizen” of the U.S. who is 18 years old or older can vote in federal, state, and local elections, instead of the existing language that says “every citizen” who is 18 years old can vote

measures.title: Colorado Amendment 77, Allow Voters in Central, Black Hawk, and Cripple Creek Cities to Expand Authorized Games and Increase Maximum Bets Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Allows voters in Central City, Black Hawk, and Cripple Creek to vote to expand allowed gaming types and bet limits

measures.title: Colorado Amendment B, Gallagher Amendment Repeal and Property Tax Assessment Rates Measure (2020)
measures.description: Repeals the Gallagher Amendment of 1982, which limited the residential and non-residential property tax assessment rates so that residential property taxes amounted to 45% of the total share of state property taxes and non-residential property taxes amounted to 55% of the total share of state property taxes

measures.title: Colorado Amendment C, Charitable Bingo and Raffles Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Requires charitable organizations to have existed for three years before obtaining a charitable gaming license instead of five years; allows charitable organizations to hire managers and operators of gaming activities so long as they are not paid more than the minimum wage

measures.title: Colorado Proposition 113, National Popular Vote Interstate Compact Referendum (2020)
measures.description: Joins Colorado into the National Popular Vote Interstate Compact, awarding Colorado's electoral votes to the winner of the national popular vote

measures.title: Colorado Proposition 114, Gray Wolf Reintroduction Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Reintroduces gray wolves on public lands

measures.title: Colorado Proposition 115, 22-Week Abortion Ban Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Prohibits abortion after 22 weeks gestational age

measures.title: Colorado Proposition 116, Decrease Income Tax Rate from 4.63% to 4.55% Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Decreases the state income tax rate from 4.63% to 4.55%

measures.title: Colorado Proposition 117, Require Voter Approval of Certain New Enterprises Exempt from TABOR Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Requires voter approval of new enterprises that are exempt from TABOR if their revenue is greater than $50 million within its first five years

measures.title: Colorado Proposition 118, Paid Medical and Family Leave Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Establishes a program for paid medical and family leave

measures.title: Colorado Proposition EE, Tobacco and E-Cigarette Tax Increase for Health and Education Programs Measure (2020)
measures.description: Increases taxes on tobacco, creates a new tax on nicotine products such as e-cigarettes; dedicates funds to education and health programs

measures.title: Florida Amendment 1, Citizen Requirement for Voting Initiative (2020)
measures.description: States in the state Constitution that only U.S. citizens who are 18 years old or older can vote in federal, state, local, or school elections

measures.title: Florida Amendment 2, $15 Minimum Wage Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Increases the state minimum wage to $15 by 2026

measures.title: Florida Amendment 3, Top-Two Open Primaries for State Offices Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Establishes a top-two open primary system for state office primary elections

measures.title: Florida Amendment 4, Require Constitutional Amendments to be Passed Twice Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Requires voter-approved constitutional amendments to be approved by voters at a second general election

measures.title: Florida Amendment 5, Extend "Save Our Homes" Portability Period Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Increases the period during which a person may transfer "Save Our Homes" benefits to a new homestead property from two years to three years

measures.title: Florida Amendment 6, Homestead Property Tax Discount for Spouses of Deceased Veterans Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Allows a homestead property tax discount to be transferred to the surviving spouse of a deceased veteran

measures.title: Georgia Amendment 1, Dedicating Tax and Fee Revenue Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Authorizes the Georgia Legislature to dedicate tax or fee revenue to the public purpose for which the taxes or fees were imposed

measures.title: Georgia Amendment 2, Allow Residents to Seek Declaratory Relief from Certain Laws Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Allows residents to seek declaratory relief from state or local laws that violate the state Constitution or state law

measures.title: Georgia Referendum A, Property Tax Exemption for Certain Charities Measure (2020)
measures.description: Exempts from property taxes property owned by a 501(c)(3) public charity if the property is owned exclusively for the purpose of building or repairing single-family homes and the charity provides interest-free financing to the individual(s) purchasing the home

measures.title: Iowa Constitutional Convention Question (2020)
measures.description: Voters determine whether Iowa will hold a constitutional convention

measures.title: Idaho Constitutional Amendment HJR4, Require 35 Legislative Districts Amendment (2020)
measures.description: States in the Idaho Constitution that there shall be 35 state legislative districts

measures.number: Allow for Graduated Income Tax Amendment
measures.title: Illinois Allow for Graduated Income Tax Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Allows for a graduated income tax

measures.title: Kentucky Constitutional Amendment 1, Marsy's Law Crime Victims Rights Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Adds a Marsy's Law to the Kentucky Constitution

measures.title: Kentucky Constitutional Amendment 2, Terms of Judicial Offices Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Extends the office terms of commonwealth's attorneys and district judges and changes licensing requirements

measures.title: Louisiana Amendment 1, Allow for Out-of-State Members to the University Board of Supervisors Amendment (December 2020)
measures.description: Allows the governor to appoint an at-large member to the board of supervisors for the University of Louisiana System from out-of-state

measures.title: Louisiana Amendment 1, No Right to Abortion in Constitution Amendment (2020)
measures.description: States that there is no right to abortion or abortion funding in the state constitution

measures.title: Louisiana Amendment 2, Include Oil and Gas Value in Tax Assessment of Wells Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Allows the presence or production of oil or gas to be taken into account when assessing the fair market value of an oil or gas well for ad valorem property tax purposes

measures.title: Louisiana Amendment 3, Use of Budget Stabilization Fund for Declared Disasters Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Allows the Louisiana State Legislature, through a two-thirds vote in each chamber, to use up to one-third of the revenue in the Budget Stabilization Fund to cover the state's costs associated with a federally-declared disaster

measures.title: Louisiana Amendment 4, Expenditures Limit Growth Formula Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Changes the state's expenditures limit growth formula

measures.title: Louisiana Amendment 5, Payments in Lieu of Property Taxes Option Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Authorizes a property tax exemption for property that is subject to an agreement with local government; allows certain property owners to make payments instead of paying property taxes

measures.title: Louisiana Amendment 6, Homestead Exemption Special Assessment Income Limit Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Increases the income limit from $50,000 to $100,000 for those who qualify for the special assessment level for residential property receiving the homestead exemption

measures.title: Louisiana Amendment 7, Unclaimed Property Permanent Trust Fund Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Creates the Unclaimed Property Permanent Trust Fund and allocates investment revenue to the general fund

measures.title: Massachusetts Question 1, "Right to Repair Law" Vehicle Data Access Requirement Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Concerns access to mechanical data in a vehicle's on-board diagnostics or telematics system

measures.title: Massachusetts Question 2, Ranked-Choice Voting Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Enacts a ranked-choice voting system for elections in Massachusetts

measures.title: Maryland Question 1, Legislative Authority over State Budget Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Authorizes the Maryland General Assembly to increase, decrease, or add items to the state budget as long as such measures do not exceed the total proposed budget submitted by the governor
measures.category: State and local government budgets, spending and finance

measures.title: Maryland Question 2, Sports Betting Measure (2020)
measures.description: Authorizes sports and events wagering at certain licensed facilities

measures.title: Maine Question 1, High-Speed Internet Infrastructure Bond Issue (July 2020)
measures.description: Authorizes $15 million in bonds for high-speed internet infrastructure

measures.title: Maine Question 1, Religious and Philosophical Vaccination Exemptions Referendum (March 2020)
measures.description: Repeals the law eliminating religious and philosophical exemptions from vaccination requirements for students and healthcare employees

measures.title: Maine Question 2, Transportation Infrastructure Bond Issue (July 2020)
measures.description: Authorizes $105 million in bonds for transportation infrastructure projects

measures.title: Michigan Proposal 1, Use of State and Local Park Funds Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Revises formula for how state and local park funds from trusts can be spent

measures.title: Michigan Proposal 2, Search Warrant for Electronic Data Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Requires search warrant to access a person's electronic data

measures.title: Missouri Amendment 1, State Executive Term Limits Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Sets a two-term limit for lieutenant governor, secretary of state, state auditor, and attorney general

measures.title: Missouri Amendment 2, Medicaid Expansion Initiative (August 2020)
measures.description: Expands Medicaid under the ACA

measures.title: Missouri Amendment 3, Redistricting Process and Criteria, Lobbying, and Campaign Finance Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Addresses redistricting process and criteria, lobbying, and campaign finance

measures.title: Mississippi Ballot Measure 1, Initiative 65 and Alternative 65A, Medical Marijuana Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Legalizes medical marijuana for qualified persons with debilitating medical conditions

measures.title: Mississippi Ballot Measure 2, Remove Electoral Vote Requirement and Establish Runoffs for Gubernatorial and State Office Elections Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Removes the requirement that a candidate for governor or state office receive the highest number of votes in a majority of the state's 122 House districts (the electoral vote requirement) and provides for a runoff election process

measures.title: Mississippi Ballot Measure 3, State Flag Referendum (2020)
measures.description: Asks voters to approve or reject a new state flag design created by the Commission to Redesign the Mississippi State Flag

measures.title: Montana C-46, Initiated Amendment Distribution Requirements Measure (2020)
measures.description: Changes language in constitution to match existing initiated amendment distribution requirements

measures.title: Montana C-47, Initiated Statute and Referendum Distribution Requirements Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Changes language in constitution to match existing initiated statute and referendum distribution requirements

measures.title: Montana CI-118, Allow for a Legal Age for Marijuana Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Authorizes the legislature or a citizen initiative to set a legal age for marijuana purchase, use, and possession

measures.title: Montana I-190, Marijuana Legalization Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Legalizes marijuana for individuals over the age of 21 and taxes the sale of non-medical marijuana at a rate of 20 percent

measures.title: Montana LR-130, Limit Local Government Authority to Regulate Firearms Measure (2020)
measures.description: Removes local governments' authority to regulate firearms, including regulation of concealed carry

measures.title: North Dakota Constitutional Measure 1, Board of Higher Education Membership Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Increases the membership of the Board of Higher Education from eight to 15, increases term length from four years to six years, and restricts membership

measures.title: North Dakota Constitutional Measure 2, Require Initiated Constitutional Amendments to be Approved by the Legislature or Passed Twice Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Requires initiated constitutional amendments passed by voters to be submitted to the legislature; if the legislature does not approve the measure, the measure would need to be placed on the ballot again, and will become effective if approved by the voters a second time

measures.title: Nebraska Amendment 1, Remove Slavery as Punishment for Crime from Constitution Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Repeals language allowing slavery or involuntary servitude as criminal punishments

measures.title: Nebraska Amendment 2, Tax Increment Financing (TIF) Repayment Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Allows TIF for 20 years for extreme blight

measures.title: Nebraska Initiative 428, Payday Lender Interest Rate Cap Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Limits the interest rate that payday lenders charge to 36 percent per year

measures.title: Nebraska Initiative 429, Authorize Laws for Gambling at Racetracks Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Changes the constitution to allow statutes authorizing games of chance at licensed racetracks

measures.title: Nebraska Initiative 430, Authorizing Gambling at Racetracks Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Authorizes games of chance at licensed racetracks and establishes a governing commission

measures.title: Nebraska Initiative 431, Tax on Gambling at Racetracks Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Enacts a tax on any games of chance operated at racetracks

measures.title: New Jersey Public Question 1, Marijuana Legalization Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Legalizes the posession and use of marijuana

measures.title: New Jersey Public Question 2, Peacetime Veterans Eligible for Property Tax Deduction Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Makes peacetime veterans eligible to receive the veterans' property tax deduction

measures.title: New Jersey Public Question 3, Delayed State Legislative Redistricting Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Delays the state legislative redistricting process and use of new districts if census data is received after February 15

measures.title: New Mexico Bond Question A, Senior Citizens Facilities Bond Issue (2020)
measures.description: Issues $33.3 million in bonds for senior citizen facility improvements

measures.title: New Mexico Bond Question B, Public Libraries Bond Issue (2020)
measures.description: Issues $9.7 million in bonds for public libraries

measures.title: New Mexico Bond Question C, Public Education Bond Issue (2020)
measures.description: Issues $156.3 million in bonds for public higher education institutions, special public schools, and tribal schools

measures.title: New Mexico Constitutional Amendment 1, Appointed Public Regulation Commission Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Makes the Public Regulation Commission a three-member appointed commission

measures.title: New Mexico Constitutional Amendment 2, Elections and Terms of Non-Statewide Officeholders Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Amends the New Mexico Constitution to allow for laws that adjust the date of election and term for non-statewide officeholders

measures.title: Nevada Question 1, Remove Constitutional Status of Board of Regents Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Removes the constitutional status of the Board of Regents

measures.title: Nevada Question 2, Marriage Regardless of Gender Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Recognizes the marriage of couples regardless of gender

measures.title: Nevada Question 3, State Board of Pardons Commissioners Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Revises duties of the State Board of Pardons Commissioners

measures.title: Nevada Question 4, State Constitutional Rights of Voters Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Creates a constitutional right to certain voting procedures and policies

measures.title: Nevada Question 6, Renewable Energy Standards Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Requires utilities to acquire 50 percent of their electricity from renewable resources by 2030

measures.title: Oklahoma State Question 802, Medicaid Expansion Initiative (June 2020)
measures.description: Expands Medicaid in Oklahoma to certain low-income adults between 18 and 65 with incomes below 133% of the federal poverty level

measures.title: Criminal History in Sentencing
measures.description: Would have prohibited courts from using prior felony convictions to enhance sentences beyond statutory maximums for nonviolent offenses.

measures.title: Oklahoma State Question 814, Decrease Tobacco Settlement Endowment Trust Fund Deposits and Fund Medicaid Program Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Decreases payments made to the Tobacco Settlement Endowment Trust Fund from 75% to 25%, directs the legislature to appropriate money from the fund to secure federal matching funds for the state's Medicaid program

measures.title: Oregon Measure 107, Campaign Finance Limits Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Authorizes the state legislature and local governments to (1) enact laws or ordinances limiting campaign contributions and expenditures; (2) require disclosure of contributions and expenditures; and (3) require that political advertisements identify the people or entities that paid for them

measures.title: Oregon Measure 108, Tobacco and E-Cigarette Tax Increase for Health Programs Measure (2020)
measures.description: Increases cigarette tax from $1.33 per pack to $3.33 per pack; imposes tax on nicotine inhalant delivery systems such as e-cigarettes at a rate of 65% of the wholesale price; dedicates revenues to the Oregon Health Authority for medical and health programs

measures.title: Oregon Measure 109, Psilocybin Mushroom Services Program Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Legalizes psilocybin mushrooms for Oregon Psilocybin Services Program under the Oregon Health Authority

measures.title: Oregon Measure 110, Drug Decriminalization and Addiction Treatment Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Decriminalizes possession of certain drugs and establishes a drug addiction treatment and recovery program funded by the state's marijuana tax revenue

measures.title: Rhode Island Question 1, Name Change Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Amends the Rhode Island Constitution to remove "Providence Plantations" from the official state name

measures.title: South Dakota Constitutional Amendment A, Marijuana Legalization Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Legalizes recreational use of marijuana; requires the legislature to pass laws providing for the use of medical marijuana and the sale of hemp by April 1, 2022

measures.title: South Dakota Constitutional Amendment B, Deadwood Sports Betting Legalization Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Legalizes sports betting in Deadwood and requires that net local revenue from such activity be dedicated to the Historic Restoration and Preservation of Deadwood

measures.title: South Dakota Initiated Measure 26, Medical Marijuana Initiative (2020)
measures.description: Provides for a medical marijuana program in South Dakota

measures.title: Utah Constitutional Amendment A, Gender-Neutral Constitutional Language Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Makes language in the state constitution gender-neutral

measures.title: Utah Constitutional Amendment B, Legislator Qualifications Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Specifies that qualifications of a legislator apply as of the time of election or appointment (rather than the time a legislator assumes office)

measures.title: Utah Constitutional Amendment C, Remove Slavery as Punishment for a Crime from Constitution Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Repeals a constitutional exception on the ban of slavery that allowed for slavery and involuntary servitude as punishment for a crime

measures.title: Utah Constitutional Amendment D, Municipal Water Resources Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Specifies the circumstances under which a municipality may commit water resources or supply water outside its boundary or exchange water resources and revise provisions surrounding municipal water rights

measures.title: Utah Constitutional Amendment E, Right to Hunt and Fish Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Creates a state constitutional right to hunt and fish for Utah residents

measures.title: Utah Constitutional Amendment F, Legislative Session Start Date Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Provides that the legislature may set the session start date in state statute; excludes state holidays from the limit of number of days in a session

measures.title: Utah Constitutional Amendment G, Use Income and Property Tax Revenue to Support Children and Individuals with Disabilities Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Allows the Legislature to use revenue from income taxes and property taxes to "support children and to support individuals with a disability"

measures.title: Virginia Question 1, Redistricting Commission Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Creates a redistricting commission to draw congressional and state legislative districts

measures.title: Virginia Question 2, Motor Vehicle Property Tax Exemption for Disabled Veterans Amendment (2020)
measures.description: Exempts one motor vehicle owned by a totally disabled veteran from property taxes

measures.title: Washington Advisory Vote 32, Nonbinding Question on Carryout Bag Tax (2020)
